person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Microgrid Infrastructure Opportunities, through The Webster Group

description.narrative: The Microgrid Infrastructure Opportunities Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) Series will consist of two separate and distinct RTMs to introduce delegates from Latin America and the Caribbean to U.S. microgrid technologies and solutions. Implementation of U.S. microgrid technologies will improve grid resilience, reliability, and increase access to electricity throughout the greater Latin America and Caribbean region. The RTMs will offer commercial opportunities for a wide range of U.S. microgrid technologies and equipment.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - ICT and Emergency Management Technologies RTM Series, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: The ICT and Emergency Management Technologies Reverse Trade Mission Series for Argentina and Peru will improve emergency response capabilities in Peru and support ICT modernization in Argentina. This two-visit series will offer commercial opportunities for a wide range of advanced ICT and emergency management technologies from the United States, including wireless communications, servers and storage devices, and broadband equipment.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - U.S. LNG Opportunities, through Gas Technology Institute

description.narrative: This activity will support U.S. private sector participation in the implementation LNG infrastructure in Latin America and the Caribbean. The program will help connect U.S. companies that export LNG, and LNG-related equipment and technologies to potential buyers in the region.

title.narrative: Subsea Fiber Optic Cable Technologies RTM, through Tuatara Group, LLC

description.narrative: The LAC Regional Subsea Fiber Optic Cable Technologies Reverse Trade Mission will familiarize up to twelve Argentine, Chilean and Ecuadorian telecommunications sector representatives with U.S. subsea and land-based fiber optic cable technologies and related infrastructure solutions. The RTM would visit up to three cities over seven business days. The RTM itinerary would include meetings and site visits with U.S. telecommunications companies, hardware deployment firms, regulators and procurement officials.

title.narrative: Central America Digital Connectivity Workshop Training Series, through Koeppen, Elliot & Associates, Ltd.

description.narrative: The Central America Digital Connectivity Workshop Training Series consists of ten online workshops focused on U.S. technologies and best practices in the information and communication technology (ICT) sector that support priority ICT infrastructure projects in Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, and Honduras.
